member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionDnsOptions.TimeToLiveInSeconds

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters
member.summary: Specifies an Endpoint configuration

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.EndpointStatus)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters class with required arguments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.DomainName
member.summary: Required. Specifies the endpoint domain name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.Location
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the location of an endpoint of type "Any". This is required for Performance policies. A list of possible values can be found under "Name" by calling List Locations: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg441293.aspx

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.MinChildEndpoints
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the minimum amount of child endpoints in a nested profile that has to be online for the endpoint to be considered online. The default is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.Status
member.summary: Required. Specifies the status of the monitoring endpoint. If set to Enabled, the endpoint is considered by the load balancing method and is monitored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.Type
member.summary: Optional. The type of endpoint being added to the definition. If there is more than one AzureWebsite endpoint, they must be in different datacenters. This limitation doesnâ€™t apply to cloud services. The default value is "CloudService".

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointCreateParameters.Weight
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the weight of an endpoint in a weighted round robin policy. The valid range is for this value is [1, 1000]. The default is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointResponse.Location
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the location of an endpoint of type Any. This is required for Performance policies

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointResponse.MinChildEndpoints
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the minimum amount of child endpoints in a nested profile that has to be online for the endpoint to be considered online.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionEndpointResponse.MonitorStatus
member.summary: Optional. Indicates health status for the endpoint.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DefinitionMonitor class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitor.HttpOptions
member.summary: Required. The option to use when making an HTTP request to monitor endpoint health.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitor.IntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Required. The number of seconds between consecutive attempts to check the status of a monitoring endpoint. The value must be set to 30.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitor.Port
member.summary: Required. The port used to monitor endpoint health. Accepted values are integer values greater than 0 and less or equal to 65,535.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitor.Protocol
member.summary: Required. The protocol to use to monitor endpoint health.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitor.TimeoutInSeconds
member.summary: Required. The time to wait for a response from the monitoring endpoint. The value must be set to 10.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitor.ToleratedNumberOfFailures
member.summary: Required. The number of consecutive failures to allow on an endpoint before taking the endpoint out of the rotation in the load balancer. The value must be set to 3.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitorHTTPOptions
member.summary: Describes the option to use when making an HTTP request to monitor endpoint health.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitorHTTPOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DefinitionMonitorHTTPOptions class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitorHTTPOptions.ExpectedStatusCode
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the HTTP status code expected from a healthy endpoint. Endpoint is considered unhealthy otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitorHTTPOptions.RelativePath
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the path relative to the endpoint domain name to probe for health state. For restrictions, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh758254.aspx.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionMonitorHTTPOptions.Verb
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the verb to use when making an HTTP request to monitor endpoint health.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.TrafficManager.Models.DefinitionPolicyCreateParameters.Endpoints
